title: Tobias Schiegl
text:
Tobias Schiegl (born 5 October 1973 in <a href="Kufstein">Kufstein</a>) is an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n <a href="luge">luge</a>r who competed from 1993 to 2010. He won fourteen medals at the <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships">FIL World Luge Championships</a> with five golds (Men's doubles: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201996">1996</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201997">1997</a>; Mixed team: 1996,1997, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201999">1999</a>), five silvers (Men's doubles: 1999, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%202003">2003</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%202007">2007</a>; Mixed team: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201993">1993</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%202008">2008</a>), and four bronzes (Men's doubles: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%202001">2001</a>, 2008; Mixed team: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201995">1995</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%202000">2000</a>). He competes in doubles with his older cousin <a href="Markus%20Schiegl">Markus</a>.
Schiegl also won eight medals at the <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships">FIL European Luge Championships</a> with two silvers (Men's doubles: <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%202002">2002</a>; Mixed team: <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%201996">1996</a>) and six bronzes (Men's doubles: <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%201998">1998</a>, <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%202000">2000</a>, <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%202010">2010</a>; Mixed team: 1994, 1998, 2002).
Competing in five <a href="Winter%20Olympics">Winter Olympics</a>, his best finish in the men's doubles event was fourth twice (<a href="1998%20Winter%20Olympics">1998</a> and <a href="2006%20Winter%20Olympics">2006</a>).
Schiegl's best overall <a href="List%20of%20Luge%20World%20Cup%20champions">Luge World Cup</a> finish was second in men's doubles twice (199394, 199899).
After his career as an athlete, Schiegl will become a coach in Austria's Luge Federation.
